author: James Freeman
title: The Trump Scoreboard - WSJ
text:
It’s politically dangerous for a President to endorse the stock market as the arbiter of his job performance. But there are benefits for both investors and voters. Here’s hoping that the man who celebrated the spectacular rise in equity prices during his first year in the Oval Office is paying attention to what’s happened since. 

The danger for a politician in using the stock-market scoreboard is that even good policies can be overwhelmed by factors unrelated to federal governance. Events at home and abroad that are beyond... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
